org.wildfly.swarm.config.infinispan

Class RemoteCacheContainer<T extends RemoteCacheContainer<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wildfly.swarm.config.infinispan.RemoteCacheContainer<T>

  • public class RemoteCacheContainer<T extends RemoteCacheContainer<T>>
extends Object
    The configuration of a remote infinispan cache container.

      • invalidationNearCache

        public T invalidationNearCache(InvalidationNearCache value)
        Configures using near cache in invalidated mode. When entries are updated or removed server-side, invalidation messages will be sent to clients to remove them from the near cache.

      • invalidationNearCache

        public T invalidationNearCache(InvalidationNearCacheConsumer consumer)
        Configures using near cache in invalidated mode. When entries are updated or removed server-side, invalidation messages will be sent to clients to remove them from the near cache.

      • invalidationNearCache

        public T invalidationNearCache()
        Configures using near cache in invalidated mode. When entries are updated or removed server-side, invalidation messages will be sent to clients to remove them from the near cache.

      • invalidationNearCache

        Configures using near cache in invalidated mode. When entries are updated or removed server-side, invalidation messages will be sent to clients to remove them from the near cache.

      • maxRetries

        public Integer maxRetries()
        Sets the maximum number of retries for each request. A valid value should be greater or equals than 0. Zero means no retry will made in case of a network failure.

      • maxRetries

        public T maxRetries(Integer value)
        Sets the maximum number of retries for each request. A valid value should be greater or equals than 0. Zero means no retry will made in case of a network failure.

      • socketTimeout

        public Integer socketTimeout()
        Enable or disable SO_TIMEOUT on socket connections to remote Hot Rod servers with the specified timeout, in milliseconds. A timeout of 0 is interpreted as an infinite timeout.

      • socketTimeout

        public T socketTimeout(Integer value)
        Enable or disable SO_TIMEOUT on socket connections to remote Hot Rod servers with the specified timeout, in milliseconds. A timeout of 0 is interpreted as an infinite timeout.
